Therefore, a high insulin level will results in effects mimicking a moderate stimulant. However, this obviously would take a large amount of sugar.

Sugar is a stimulant and turkey is a sedative. Actually you are wrong on both counts. Again, sugar releases tryptophan in the brain provided there is not a large amount of protein blocking this action. The tryptophan then converts to serotonin, which is calming and antidepressant.
Sugar is neither a sedative or a stimulant it is glucose. A large jolt of sugar may increase your energy but usually is short lived and you feel worse when it drops off.

Sugar is not a stimulant by itself, however, it causes the production of insulin. Insulin is a hormone vital to regulating the amount of energy in your body. Therefore, a high insulin level will results in effects mimicking a moderate stimulant. However, this obviously would take a large amount of sugar.
